channel.title: jira.namics.com
channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4748] Override QueryBean in the HMC for FF-Export-Cronjobs
item.description:
It should be possible to override the ExportQuery- and ParameterProvider Beans for a specific CronJob in order to test changes with the same data.

For this 2 new attributes should be added to the DistFactFinderExportJob to specify this strategy beans. As Fallback (if there's no definition) the default strategy (from the xml bean definition) should be used.
item.summary: Override QueryBean in the HMC for FF-Export-Cronjobs

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4647] Family View: FE adaptations to product list item, detail page
item.description:
Ticket for the FE part of the new family view:

  • Adaptation of the product list
    • Addition of a link "Family"
    • Spec: https://wiki.namics.com/display/distrelint/904a+-+Adaptation+to+normal+product+list
  • Adaptation of product detail page
    • Link to "Family" on top
    • New button below "similar products"
    • Spec: https://wiki.namics.com/display/distrelint/904b+-+Adaptation+to+Product+Detail+Page
item.summary: Family View: FE adaptations to product list item, detail page

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Please align with Raphael Husi on how to implement so that it doesn't interfere if BE is delayed

Frontend is fully prepared. As soon as the Product Family URL is available from the Backend, the property needs to be replaced with the value from $

{product.xxx}

in the following files:

  • article-numbers.jsp
  • product.jsp
  • product-detail-page.jsp
  • product-dot-tpl.jsp
  • product-technical.jsp
  • product-technical-dot-tpl.jsp
  • productlist-detail-page.jsp
  • loadProductsForFacetSearch.jsp
  • showMoreProducts.jsp

The Family link is only getting showed, if the property is not empty.
As discussed with Raphi, I assign the ticket to him for further development.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4581] Search Result: Implement Technical View
item.description:
A new product list pattern "technical view" (along the existing normal list pattern) needs to be implemented as specified here:

https://wiki.namics.com/display/distrelint/903+-+Search+Result+Technical+View

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: If reasonable, DISTRELEC-2052 should also be covered with the refactoring.
url that contains products local: http://distrelec-ch.local:9001/de/Stromversorgung-%26-Licht/Batterien-Ladeger%C3%A4te-Regenerativ/Ladeger%C3%A4te/c/cat-L3D_525546

The Technical View will be on the following pages:

  • all search result
  • product hierarchy pages (including the new product family view)
  • product lists that are part of the detail page (similar products)

Open TODO:

Backend:

  • Store current view property in Cookie and deliver the property on every call for products (Search Page, Category Page, Ajax Facet, Show More, View Switch)
  • Deliver 10 Top A Attributes as a List containing Hashmaps, each Hashmap needs to reflect one Attribute with key being label and value being the attribute value

Frontend:

  • Display Correct Technical Attributes in technical View
  • Check if the switch works with Ajax Facets, Show more and on all Pages where it should be
Property viewType wird entweder "standard" oder "technical"

The attributes that need to be delivered for the technical view are:
Top 10 WebUseA and WebUseB attributes (B only if there are less than 10 A attributes. If A and B combined are less than 10, the remaining spots stay empty)

EDIT:
Top 10 WebUse attributes as per WebUse attribute sequence of FactFinder (per category). If there are fewer than 10 WebUse attributes on a product, the remaining spots stay empty.
This feature will be implemented in an own feature branch: /branches/feature-rle-4581-technical-view

Changed Order of the webuse-Attributes in the Factfinder-Export. The Attributes will be sorted by the Position on the ClassAttributeAssignment.

This should also speed up the export and should be tested on DEV tomorrow.

==> The attributes will now be delievered from Factfinder in the new order but there are no speed improvements for the exports (all CH-Exports on DEV run about 30 minutes - as before)

TODO from FE Perspective:

  • Use Correct Icons for Buttons when delivered from Florian
  • Check if EOL / Not buyable products are being displayed at Similar Products. If yes, they need additional formatting, since there is currently only the template product-detail-page.jsp which was optimized for the technical view, since products there are always in technical view.
As of the decision of Florian, EOL / Not buyable Products should always be displayed in standard view, even if the actual user switched to technical view.

Decision from Florian: EOL products shall NOT be visible in the list of similar products on a product detail page.
@Jan: No additional template for similar products is required.
@Remo: Please remove (filter) EOL products from the list of similar products on the detail page. --> done
Icons: Please use original HV icons for the time being, so that the functionality can already be tested in Q. The designer is on holiday and will return only next week.

• Images to be changed (see sub-task).
  • Implemented. Please test.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-2900] Add search overview on family and serie, adapt product lists and detail page
item.description:
To be able to find the right product really quick, a link on the family triggering a search (like on the productline) would help. This is most helpful in examples like Steckverbinder where we have Stecker and Buchse.

Best would be the breadcrumb with:
...Productline / Family / Serie

And clicking on Family/Serie would trigger the same behavior than clicking on "Productline" (as implemented) returning to a search list view.

Detailed Specification:
https://wiki.namics.com/display/distrelint/904+-+Family+View
item.summary: Add search overview on family and serie, adapt product lists and detail page

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Please provide clear requirements

see printscreens.

In case of Steckverbinder we need to be able to find Buchse und Stecker without trouble. This is just one example of type of products for which this type of info is required but we have a lot more.

Could you please think about a possible solution?
Input: We could solve it through a PIM flag like the manufacturer stores.
I have added some more detailed designs.

Detailed Specification:
https://wiki.namics.com/display/distrelint/904+-+Family+View

Removed original mockups, as they have been replaced with the final detailed specification: https://wiki.namics.com/display/distrelint/904+-+Family+View

  • Adaptation to product list: https://wiki.namics.com/display/distrelint/904a+-+Adaptation+to+normal+product+list
  • Adaptation to detail page: https://wiki.namics.com/display/distrelint/904b+-+Adaptation+to+Product+Detail+Page
Created sub-ticket for FE implementation DISTRELEC-4647
